studyTitle: Nirogacestat, a Œ≥-Secretase Inhibitor for Desmoid Tumors.
author: Mrinal Gounder et al.
primaryOutcomeResults: Nirogacestat had a significant progression-free survival benefit over placebo (hazard ratio for disease progression or death, 0.29; 95% confidence interval, 0.15 to 0.55; P<0.001); the likelihood of being event-free at 2 years was 76% with nirogacestat and 44% with placebo.
conclusion: Nirogacestat was associated with significant benefits with respect to progression-free survival, objective response, pain, symptom burden, physical functioning, role functioning, and health-related quality of life in adults with progressing desmoid tumors.
gPTSummary: This was a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled phase 3 trial of nirogacestat in adults with progressing desmoid tumors. The sample size was 70 (nirogacestat) vs. 72 (placebo). The primary outcome was progression-free survival, which showed significant benefits with nirogacestat (hazard ratio for disease progression or death, 0.29; 95% confidence interval, 0.15 to 0.55; P<0.001).
